title: Dietary Record Protocol: Weighed Food Record and Recall
title_html: Dietary Record Protocol: Weighed Food Record and Recall
article_citation: Rahmannia S, Diana A, Luftimas DE, Gurnida DA, Herawati DMD, Houghton LA, Gibson RS (2019) Poor dietary diversity and low adequacy of micronutrient intakes among rural Indonesian lactating women from Sumedang district, West Java. PLoS ONE 14(7): e0219675. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0219675

authors.name: Rosalind Susan Gibson
authors.affiliation: Department of Human Nutrition, University of Otago, Dunedin, New Zealand

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Use Weighed Record Form (Form A) and Recipe Form (Form B).

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: First, record mother’s name, ID number,interview date, day of the week and cadre’s name at the top of each page of theweighed food record form.  Use a separateset of forms for each respondent.

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Start by calibrating the scale withstandard weight (500 Rp silver coin) andrecord the calibration weight on the form.

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Make sure that the scale displays a “0”(zero) before you start.

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Record in column 3 each food and drink(including snacks and drinkingwater)consumed by mother in sequential order; start with the first item consumed sincethe cadre arrives in the morning, and finish with the last item consumed beforethe cadre leaves.

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Record time (column 1) and place (column 2) for when and where each food and drink (including snacks) is consumed. Use more than one page per day as needed

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Also record all snacks, meals, or drinksconsumed outside the house. Therefore, the cadres should accompany mothers andbring their tools (scale, forms, and pen/pencil) so that any snacks, meals, ordrinks consumed outside the house during the recording day can be weighed andrecorded on the Weighed Record Form.

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Record the name of food or drink as they are consumed in column 3 of the Weighed Record Form (Form A).

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: For mixed dishes: record the name of the mixed dish on Weighed Record Form (Form A) (e.g., vegetable stir-fry, friedrice) in column 3 and note the number of the recipe in column 9. Record thesame number of this recipe on the Recipe Form (Form B).

source.title: Recording the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description: Also note in column 9 of the WeighedRecord Form (Form A) if the cook has prepared the mixed dish the day before,then proceed with asking the details of ingredients of the mixed dish using therecall procedure

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Introduce yourself to the respondents; explain the objectives of the session.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Explain to the respondents the purpose of the weighed food record and the procedures involved. Ensure that this explanation is consistent with the information given on the consent form.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Explain that the procedure consists of three components: a) Recording all foods and drinks consumed during the food record period; b) Describing the foods and drinks consumed during the food record period; c)Weighing the amounts of food and drinks consumed during the food record period.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Explain that this procedure will be used for the mother.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Explain the importance of following a usual eating pattern on the intake recording day: this will decrease the likelihood of altering eating behavior on the recall day.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Explain that you will record a description and weigh each ingredient used in the mixed dishes in the home. The weight of the mixed dish after cooking will also be recorded.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: If the mixed dish was prepared before then the detail of the ingredients and the amounts must be recalled using Food List with item designated for record of mixed dishes involving separate ingredients marked. The amount of mixed dish after cooking must be estimated using the methods given in this protocol.

source.title: Preparing the Respondents for Weighed Record

source.description: Prepare a visiting schedule for each respondent. Inform the respondent that the cadre will arrive at their household at 06.00 AM on the scheduled survey days and to stay there until 06.00 PM (for 12 hours).

source.title: Preparing the Cadre for the Weighed Record: Conduct training for the cadres

source.description: Explain procedures with examples and simulations.

source.title: Preparing the Cadre for the Weighed Record: Conduct training for the cadres

source.description: Equip the cadres with tools needed: scale, set of forms, pen/pencil, plate/bowl, cup, and spoon.

source.title: Preparing the Cadre for the Weighed Record: Conduct training for the cadres

source.description: Carry out a training session with respondents, accompanied by the instructors.

source.title: Preparing the Cadre for the Weighed Record: Conduct training for the cadres

source.description: Evaluate practice results.

source.title: Describing the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description:
Record the description of each food or drink in column 4 according to the guidelines in Table1
ABC
1 Food type
Required detailed information
Cooking Method
2 Rice
Kind of rice: white/brown
Sticky rice / not Porridge / steamed rice Condiments
Boiled / fried
Steam / baked
3 Flesh meat Kind of meat: beef/goat/lamb/ Description of cut: lean/thick; fat removed/plus fat With bone/not Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed/braised
4 Organ meats Kind of organ: liver/kidney/intestines/heart Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed/braised
5 Fish/ sea food Kind of fish: fresh/dried/canned such as anchovies, tuna, sardines; roe/fish eggs Kind of shell fish: clams/oysters/shrimp Snails; Octopus/squid Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed/braised
6 Poultry Kind of poultry: chicken/duck/bird Parts or pieces eaten: breast/thigh/wing/feet/etc. Raw / cooked weight White / dark meat With / without skin With / without bones Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed/braised
7 Dark yellow or orange-fleshed roots, tubers, and others Carrot; Pumpkin; Red Pepper (sweet); Squash (orange or dark yellow-fleshed only); sweet potato (orange or dark yellow-fleshed only) Fresh/ frozen/ canned Peeled/ unpeeled Boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed
8 Roots, tubers, and plantains (non-coloured items) Bread fruit; Cassava; Turnip; Yam; Potatoes (purple/blue/pink/yellow); Sweet potato (white/pale yellow-fleshed) Peeled/unpeeled Fresh/dried Prepared as stiff porridge or noodles Boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed
9 Milk products Kind of milk: cow/goat/horse; Type of milk: fresh/dried/UHT; Full cream/2% fat/skimmed/low fat Brand name (if appropriate) Fortified / not Ice cream: kind of ice cream Yoghurt: kind of milk; sweetened/unsweetened; fruit added/plain
10 Cheese Kind of processed cheese: block/sheets Brand name (if appropriate) Low fat/regular
11 Bird’s Eggs Kind: chicken/duck/quail Part of eggs consumed: yolk/white part/whole Boiled/fried/baked/scrambled/poached/omelet
12 Fats, oils, & butter Butter; Margarine (fortified/unfortified); Mayonnaise; Palm oil (NOT red palm oil); Cream; Oil (vegetable/nut/seed); Coconut milk
13 Bread, rolls Type of grain: wheat/rice/etc. Type of flour Brand Size Toasted/baked/not Added ingredients: jam/others
14 Baked goods Type of product: cakes/biscuits/pastries Homemade/commercial Iced/not (type of icing); Filled/not; Type of filling: sugar/cram/jam/chocolate
15 Cereals and other grains Corn; Oats; Wheat Whole/refined Fresh/dried Porridge: thin/thick/stiff(steamed rice) Fermented/unfermented Brand name Noodles: instant/fresh/glass/rice/etc. Fortified/unfortified Added: milk/water/oil/spices/sugar/none Boiled/steamed/baked/fried
16 Beans, peas, lentils, nuts & seeds Kind of bean: red bean/mung bean/soy bean/ peanut/etc. Sprouted/not Soy products: fermented (tofu/tempeh/tauco/etc.) / unfermented Gnemon: fresh/dried (chips) Peanuts: with/without skin; raw/roasted/fried; peanut butter Mung bean porridge; Mung bean noodle Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried with/without salt
17 Dark green leafy vegetables Cassava greens; Chinese cabbage; Bitter leaf; Broccoli; Lettuce; Papaya leaves; Spinach; Sweet potato leave; Water spinach; Stalk and leaves/ leaves only Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed
18 Other vegetables Bamboo shoot; Bitter melon; Bean sprouts; Cabbage; Cauliflower; Corn; Cucumbers; Eggplant; Garlic; Green pepper; Lettuce; Luffa: Mushroom; Onion; Shallot; Tomato (red/yellow/green/ not orange) Peeled/unpeeled Stalk and leaves/leaves only Fresh/boiled/fried/baked/stir-fried/steamed/stewed
19 Fruits (dark yellow or orange) Mango; Papaya; Passion fruit (ripe): Cantaloupe melon; Loquat; Hog plum; Persimmon (ripe) Peeled/unpeeled Fresh/boiled/baked/dried
20 Other Fruits Apple; Avocado; Banana; Coconut flesh; Durian; Grape fruit; Grapes; Guava; Jackfruit; Lemon; Lime; Litchi; Honeydew melon; Orange; Pear; Pineapple; Pomegranate; Rambutan; Star fruit; Strawberry; Tangerine; Watermelon Peeled/unpeeled Fresh/boiled/baked/dried/canned
21 Beverages, soup Fresh / frozen Fruit juice Sweetened / unsweetened Added vitamins or minerals Coffee: instant/ground; water/milk added Recipe
22 Street foods and processed foods Type of food Brand name Package size Price per portion Condiments added Vendor’s name/location Write ingredients and amounts from packet Fortified/not Ask the mother where the product was purchased, collect the package, detail from the package should be recorded.
23 Mixed dishes Dish name Brand name Homemade/commercial List recipe ingredients Total amount cooked Total amount consumed by mother
24 Condiments Chilies; Fish sauce; Salty soy sauce; Stock cubes; Sweet soy sauce; spices. Brand names Cooking method of the dish

source.title: Describing the Foods and Drinks Consumed

source.description:
For mixed dishes, record the following in Recipe Form (Form B):
  • Description of each ingredient in column 4 following the guidelines in table 1 (BFC_SOP15).
  • Make sure you remember to enter each condiment,(e.g., sweet soy sauces, chili sauce) and seasoning (e.g., gule seasoning, semur seasoning) on a separate line in column 4 of Recipe Form.
  • Cooking method in column 5 (e.g., boiling, baking, frying, roasting, etc.)

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description: The actual weight of each food and beverages consumed (including mixed dishes) must be recorded. Note particularly that the weights should be of the food as eaten. For example, do not record the weight or size of a raw chicken leg: instead, record the weight of the chicken meat consumed after it has been cooked.

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description:
1. Using the dietary scales:
  • Adjust the scale to zero
  • Place the plate, bowl or cup on the scale, then record the weight
  • Adjust the scale to zero again
  • Place the first food or beverage item of the meal on the weighed plate, bowl, or cup
  • Read and record the weight of the first food or beverage item of the meal (in grams) in the column 6 of the food record form
  • Adjust the scale to zero again
  • Add the next item of food and record its weight
  • Again, adjust the scale to zero; and
  • Repeat this taring, weighing, and recording procedure until all the food and beverage items in the meal have been measured.

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description: If there is leftover on the subject’s plate, please transfer the leftovers to another plate

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description: Put the empty plate that was used for eating on the scale, and then transfer each ingredient of leftovers separately on to the plate and weigh.

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description: Record the weigh of the plate and each leftover ingredient every time.

source.title: Weighing the Amounts of Food and Drink

source.description: If each ingredient cannot be separated, weigh the plate, bowl, or cup and all the leftovers together.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: The following details should be recorded on the mixed dish recipe form. Use a separate form for each “designated” mixed dish consumed by the respondent.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record the name of the interviewer, date,day food eaten, and the subject’s name and ID number at the top of the recipeform.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record local and general name of the mixeddish on the form (e.g., chicken curry).  Weightof the whole mixed dish cooked isrecorded in column 7b while part ofit consumed by the subject will be recorded in the Weighed Record Form.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record the weight of the empty cooking pot in column 7a.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record the name of each ingredient of the mixed dish on a separate line of the form in column 3, followed by a complete description of each ingredient in column

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record a complete of each ingredients in column 4 usingtable 1for the description of theingredient.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record the weight of the edible portion (i.e., as eaten) of eachraw ingredient recorded in column 6.For example, for ingredients such as bananas, remove the skin part and only theedible portion is weighed.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: If seasoning pwder is used in the recipe, record onlyseasoning powder and the name of the recipe not individual spices or theiramount.

source.title: Complete the Recipe Form.

source.description: Record the final weight of the cookedmixed dish plus the cooking pot in column 7b.

source.title: Calculate the Weight of Each Cooked Ingredient Consumed

source.description: Where possible, it is preferable to express the weight equivalents of ingredients consumed in mixed dishes as cooked foods to take into account any weight changes that may arise after cooking. This approach allows nutrient values for cooked foods to be used, and thus any nutrient losses or gains during cooking are taken into account. The steps involved are listed below.

source.title: Calculate the Weight of Each Cooked Ingredient Consumed

source.description: Apply a weight change factor to adjust the weight of the raw ingredients to cooked weights. Use the Australian/New Zealand or USDA weight change factors if local data are not available. For example, if the weight of raw carrots in mixed dish = 55g and weight change factor for boiled carrots = − 7%, then the loss of weight of carrots after boiling is: 55g = 55 × (7/100) = 3.85g. Therefore, the cooked weight of the carrots is: 55 − 3.85 = 51.15g. (Note if carrots had gained weight, then 3.85 g would have been added to the raw weight value). Enter this cooked weight in column 5 of the recipe form. Repeat this calculation for each raw ingredient listed in step 1, applying weight change factors as appropriate.

source.title: Calculate the Weight of Each Cooked Ingredient Consumed

source.description: Calculate the proportion of each cooked ingredient in the homemade mixed dish recipe by dividing the weight of each cooked ingredient by the total cooked weight (in g) of the mixed dish. Record these proportions in column 8 of the recipe form.

source.title: Calculate the Weight of Each Cooked Ingredient Consumed

source.description:
Calculate the weight equivalent of each cooked ingredient consumed by the respondent by multiplying the proportion of each cooked ingredient in column 8 by the total weight of the cooked mixed dish (in grams) consumed by the respondent. Enter these weight equivalents in column 9 of the recipe form and in column 6 of the weighed record form.
AB
1 Food type Weight change factors (%)
2 Boiled rice 189
3 Grains (other than rice) simmered eg. Maize porridge −13
4 Other grains (boiled) 54
5 Carrots & similar root vegetables −7
6 Leaf & stalk vegetables, boiled −15
7 Peas & edible podded peas −7
8 Tomato, boiled −22
9 Pumpkin, baked −15
10 Squash, Zucchini, boiled −16
11 Other vegetables, boiled
12 Corn-on-cob −1
13             Corn kernels −4
14             Onions, boiled −10
15 Vegetable mixture, boiled −11
16 Mature legumes and pulses
17             Beans, dried, boiled 149
18             Chick peas, dried, boiled 163
19              Split lentils, dried, boiled 227
20              Whole lentils, dried, boiled 142
21              Split peas 150

AB
1 Food type Weight change factors (%)
2 Boiled rice 189
3 Grains (other than rice) simmered eg. Maize porridge −13
4 Other grains (boiled) 54
5 Carrots & similar root vegetables −7
6 Leaf & stalk vegetables, boiled −15
7 Peas & edible podded peas −7
8 Tomato, boiled −22
9 Pumpkin, baked −15
10 Squash, Zucchini, boiled −16
11 Other vegetables, boiled
12 Corn-on-cob −1
13             Corn kernels −4
14             Onions, boiled −10
15 Vegetable mixture, boiled −11
16 Mature legumes and pulses
17             Beans, dried, boiled 149
18             Chick peas, dried, boiled 163

source.title: 12-HOUR WEIGHED FOOD RECORD
12-HOUR FOOD RECALL INSTRUCTION

source.description: How to ask mothers to recall what they ate from 6 pm (18.00) yesterday to 6 am (6.00) today

source.title: Introduction

source.description: Remind the mother that the questionswill only cover all food and drinks that she consumed from 6 pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6 am (6.00hours) today.

source.title: Introduction

source.description: Stress that all the responses of themother will be confidential.

source.title: Introduction

source.description: Stress the importance of providing thecorrect information.

source.title: Introduction

source.description: Give the mothers sufficient time toconsider their responses and to clarify answers where necessary. At all times during the interview, keep an openmind and avoid showing signs of surprise, approval, or disapproval of the mother’seating pattern

source.title: List of all food and drink consumed from 6pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6am (6.00 hours) today

source.description: Start the interview with the following: “I would like you to tell me what you had to eat or drink from 6 pm (18 hours) yesterday to 6 am (6.00 hours) today.” Next ask, “What was the first thing you ate or drank from 6 pm yesterday? What did you have next and at what time?”

source.title: List of all food and drink consumed from 6pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6am (6.00 hours) today

source.description: Proceed through the evening, repeating these questions as necessary, and record each food or drink (including drinking water) consumed in column 3 of the recall form. Remember to probe for any snacks and drinks consumed after the main evening meals and during the night or away from home

source.title: List of all food and drink consumed from 6pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6am (6.00 hours) today

source.description: Make sure that each new food or drink consumed is entered on a new line in column 3 of the form

source.title: List of all food and drink consumed from 6pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6am (6.00 hours) today

source.description: If a designated mixed dish is consumed record on the recall form: steamed rice (mixed dish – see recipe) in column 3 of the Recall Form (Form C), and write the number of recipe in column 8 of the Recall Form (Form C) and column 1 on the Recipe Form (Form D)

source.title: List of all food and drink consumed from 6pm (18.00 hours) yesterday to 6am (6.00 hours) today

source.description: When the end of the time period (i.e., 6 am today) has been reached, check to make sure that all the items (including drinks and snacks) have been entered on the Recall Form(Form C)

source.title: Describing the foods and drinks consumed

source.description: Note that description of seasonings and condiments (e.g sweet soy sauce, chili sauce, etc)should also be included because they are often an important source of micronutrients. When different types of flour are used for the staple, record the specific flour type (e.g., refined [preferably with extraction-rate] or unrefined (e.g. whole wheat) on the recall form. Always consult to the table 1 for the descriptions of all food and drink

source.title: Describing the foods and drinks consumed

source.description: Go back over the list of foodand drink recorded in column 3, and for each food and drink item in the recall, record the timein column 1, place in column 2, and then a complete description (column 4) of each itemon the recall form. Consult the descriptions that have been prepared for each itemin Table 1.When appropriate, brand name of the processed food should also been recorded in column 3 on the form

source.title: Describing the foods and drinks consumed

source.description:
1. For homemade designated mixed dishes, record on the recipe form (Form D) the following details:
Number of recipe (column 1)
Name of each ingredient of mixed dishes (column 2)
All ingredients (column 3)
Description of all ingredients (column 4)
Method of preparation and cooking (column 5)
Note : If the mixed dished is not on the food list, always collect the recipe
*Note: If the mother does not know the amount of each ingredient, try and find out about the ratio of the main ingredients of a mixed dish. For example, for a vegetable mixture containing potatoes, sweet potato, and dark green leafy vegetables, you must find out about the ratio of each of these items in the final dish.
**Note: Ask the mother to indicate the level on the side of the cooking pot. Fill the empty cooking pot up to the level indicates with beans or water and measure the weight. Record the total weight of the cooked mixed dish in gr at the top of the recipe form.

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: This is the most challenging part of the recall interview, but also one of the most critical for ensuring high quality results. Examples of ways to estimate portion sizes of specific food items are listed in the Table 2.Weigh leftovers for food whenever possible because mothers will find it easier to visualize the amounts consumed when these are used

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Start at the beginning of the itemized list of foods and drinks already recorded during Step 1 on the recall form

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description:
Select the method for estimating the amount consumed by first checking the methods recommended in Table 2, and then following the appropriate detailed instructions below
AB
1 Estimate weight using: Notes
2 REAL FOOD – from left over Most preferred method! Always ask mother whether there is left over from what mother ate yesterday. Weigh according to the amount that mother ate.
3 Plasticine / Play-doh Use plasticine if there is no left over food. Use plasticine for solid food and pieces of food. Ask mother to make a replica as similar as it could be to the shape and size of food she ate using the plasticine.
4 Water Use water if the item mother consumed is mostly water. Use water to estimate volume of drinks mother consumed. Pour water into the glass/cup/etc. that mother used, weigh the water in it.

AB
1 Estimate weight using: Notes
2 REAL FOOD – from left over Most preferred method! Always ask mother whether there is left over from what mother ate yesterday. Weigh according to the amount that mother ate.
3 Plasticine / Play-doh Use plasticine if there is no left over food. Use plasticine for solid food and pieces of food. Ask mother to make a replica as similar as it could be to the shape and size of food she ate using the plasticine.
4 Water Use water if the item mother consumed is mostly water. Use water to estimate volume of drinks mother consumed. Pour water into the glass/cup/etc. that mother used, weigh the water in it.

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Ask the mother to first visualize the amount of the food consumed

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Adjust the dietary scale to zero, and then place the empty plate,bowl, or cupused by the mother on the scale and record the weight (column 6)

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Adjust the scale to zero again

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Ask the mother to measure the amount eaten using the method from Table 2.Ask the mother to confirm the amount shown was actually eaten by asking, ‘Did you eat all of this?’.Remove any leftovers, if necessary, and then weigh and record the amount consumed (in grams) in column 7a (if using real food),column 7b (if using plasticine), or column 7c (if using water) on the recall form (Form C)

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: When,eggs,biscuits, buns, slices of bread, and candies, were consumed, please count the number of each item. Record the number in column 7a

source.title: Estimating the amount of foods and beverages consumed

source.description: Make sure that you record on the recall form and the recipe form the amount of each mixed dish consumed by the mother

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: The following details should be recorded on the mixed dish recipe form. Use a separate form for each “designated” mixed dish consumed by the respondent

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: Record the name of the interviewer, date, day food eaten, the location, and the subject’s name and ID number at the top of the recipe form

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description:
Record the number of the mixed dish on the form.
If the mother has any leftoversor real food, record the weight of the empty plate, bowl, or cup she used incolumn 6. Then ask the mother to estimate the original amount of the mixed dish she ateusing the leftovers. Record in column 7a

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: If there are no leftoversor real food, ask the mother to estimate the volume using clay or plasticine, try to made a similar shape of mixed dish. Record the weight of plasticine ingram, in column 7b

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: For all mixed dishes use water to estimate the total cooked volume. Fill the utensil in which mixed dish was cooked with water up to the level indicated by the mother. Measure the weight of water in grams and record in column 7c

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: Record the name of each ingredient of the mixed dish on a separate line of the form in column 3,followed by a complete description of each ingredient in column 4

source.title: Complete the recipe form during the food recall

source.description: Weight all volume of the whole cooked mixed dish cooked is recorded in column 8b, while the amount consumed by the subject will be recorded in the Recall Form

source.title: Finalizing the recall form

source.description: Check the form for all the required information: time, place, name of food/drink, full descriptionsof all foods, amount eaten (including mixed dishes) for each food or drink(including drinking water)

source.title: Finalizing the recall form

source.description: Ask the questions at the bottom of the recall form: Was food intake unusual etc.? Record the answers on the bottom of the form

source.title: Finalizing the recall form

source.description: Check whether the mother had taken any medication or vitamin and mineral supplements in the recall period

source.title: Finalizing the recall form

source.description: Most importantly, thank the respondent for her time and co-operation

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: This can be done at the end of the study when all the recalls and weighed records have been collected

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Prepare a list of all the food orbeverage items purchased as “street foods”

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Classify items into types of itemsbased on the composition of the major staple and cooking method.

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Visit ~ five vendors in the studyarea who sell each of the classified items and ask for information on eachingredient, method of preparation of each ingredient, the amount, methodof cooking, and total volume or weight of prepared dish. Enter these dataon a recipe form.

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Convert the amount of each ingredientin the recipe into weight equivalents

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Compile nutrient values for eachingredient from a local food composition table.

source.title: Estimating the composition of street foods (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Use the chop suey SOP spreadsheet to calculate the nutrient content of the mixed dish (per 100 g), applying USDA retention and yield factors where appropriate.Calculate an averagenutrient composition (per 100 g) for each street food type from the fiveitems collected from the vendor. This nutrient composition will be added as aline in your food composition table for the nutrient composition of thatspecific type of street food

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: The first stage in the conversion of foods to nutrients is to convert the amount of each of the food items consumed and recorded in column 4 of the recall form into weight equivalents; these data are entered into column 5 of the recall form. Several methods can be used, including using published specific gravity data for the items for which the amounts consumed have been reported in mL and the formula: (weight (g) = volume (mL) x specific gravity (g/mL) (see FAO specific gravity data), and nutrient composition tables (eg USDA) for portion sizes given in household measures and grams

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: The amount of each raw ingredient (excluding water) recorded on the recipe form for each mixed dish must also be converted to weight equivalents and entered into column 4 of the recipe form

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: The amount of the mixed dish eaten by the respondent and the total amount of the recipe must also be converted to weight equivalents

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Next calculate the proportion of each raw ingredient in the homemade mixed dish recipe by dividing the weight of each raw ingredient by the total cooked weight (in g) of the mixed dish. Record these proportions in column 6 of the recipe form

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Then calculate the weight equivalent of each raw ingredient consumed by the mother by multiplying the proportion of each raw ingredient in column 6 by the weight of the cooked mixed dish (in grams) consumed by the respondent. Enter these weight equivalents in column 7of the recipe form. Applying an example, if person was said to consume 120 g pumpkin leaf relish, then the corresponding weight equivalents for the three raw ingredients consumed would be: 120 x 0.52 = 62.4 g of leaves; 120 x 0.13 = 15.6 g tomato; and 120 x 0.08 = 9.6 g groundnut flour. These are the weights that should be entered into column 7 of the recipe form and transferred to column 5 of the 24-hr recall form

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: You are now ready to code and then calculate the energy and nutrient intakes using a nutrient analysis system. You can use STATA/SPSS for your nutrient analysis.Consult your handout on how to perform this task

source.title: Calculating the weight of the ingredients of a mixed dish consumed by the respondent (to be performed by the dietary coordinator)

source.description: Check your input data for coding and weight errors. Strategies for detecting weight errors are given in your handout

description: This protocol explains how to conduct a 12-hour weighed food record (by cadres or mothers) and 12-hour food recall.
